p: Again, Salehi with an international team provided a deed analysis of the Cucurbita genus [ 27]. The traditional efficacy against gastrointestinal diseases and intestinal parasites were correlated with their nutritional and phytochemical composition. Among chemical constituents, carotenoids, tocopherols, phenols, terpenoids, saponins, sterols, fatty acids, and functional carbohydrates and polysaccharides were those occurring in higher abundance. More recently, a huge interest in a class of triterpenoids, cucurbitacins, has been stated.
